oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville Race Course historic marker, Nashville, Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An historic marker for the Nashville Race Course that reads: “The Nashville Race Course, the “Burns Island Track,” 1828-1884, was .6 of a mile north. Here Oct. 10, 1843, was run the then richest race in the world, the $35,000 Peyton Stakes, 4 mile heats, promoted by Ballie Peyton. The winner owned by Thomas Kirkman, was renamed ‘Peytona.’ Ten Broeck and Thora also raced here.” This marker is located at the intersection of Vantage Way and Great Circle Rd., Nashville, Tennessee in Davidson County. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
